description: Calque of Middle English medeful; equivalent to meed +â€Ž -ful.

adjectives.description: meedful (comparative more meedful, superlative most meedful)

entries.meaning: Worthy of meed or reward; deserving; meritorious.
examples: "On that day that S. Louis was buried," we there read, "a woman of the diocese of Sens recovered her sight, which she had lost and saw nothing, by the merits and prayers of the said debonair and meedful king.
